content: Today I've seen three separate clearly AI-powered accounts spam on PRs to mathlib: ayestore, eyestoreoye, eyestorefivemstore. See eg #24747

What do we do? Is it reasonable to restrict interaction with our repos to people who have push access? That makes up a lot of the people who could reasonably be commenting on a PR, but probably not all

Yeah, it seems to be happening across GitHub: https://github.com/leanprover-community/queueboard/issues/99

I've been blocking the accounts from leanprover-community as they pop up
-1 for restricting repos to people with write access. Spams like this are annoying but opening issues/PR and discussing them should remain open to everyone, regardless of push access.
#24743 was another one (thanks Yael for removing it)
Any screenshot / archived page of the bots' behavior?
It was generic posts of the form "this is an insightful PR" by various bot accounts whose home pages were just ads
All my PRs are insightful and my LinkedIn profiles pristine :sparkles:
Apparently my performance optimizations are quite clever, and I did nice engineering work :sparkles: too bad it was basically a copy of one of Yaëls PRs to try to debug the import summary issue...
